meanings.definition: The quality or state of being silly or foolish.
meanings.sent1: Her daftness always made us laugh during class.
meanings.sent2: His daftness in trying to juggle too many tasks at once led to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The daftness of wearing mismatched socks to a formal event was evident.
meanings.sent4: The daftness of his decision to swim in icy waters became clear as he shivered uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The daftness of the clown's antics left the audience in stitches.

meanings.definition: A silly or foolish act or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The daftness of his prank caused a lot of laughter among his friends.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but giggle at the daftness of the puppy chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent3: The daftness of trying to fit a large box into a small car was comical.
meanings.sent4: His daftness in believing he could fly like a bird was both amusing and dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The daftness of the raccoon stealing cookies from the jar was caught on camera.
